abstract.p: Merrill Lynch is pulling plug on two Web sites designed to help its brokerage customers make consumer purchases, Shopmerrill.com and Merrillauctions.com (S)

block.p: Merrill Lynch still wants to help its small-business customers get good deals on office supplies. But it no longer is the place for individual investors to turn for bargains on blazers or to bid on Beanie Babies. Less than a year after leaping headlong into electronic commerce, Merrill is quietly pulling the plug on two World Wide Web sites designed to help its brokerage customers make consumer purchases, Shopmerrill.com and Merrillauctions.com Both sites are scheduled to shut down at the end of August. ''Basically, what we're doing is refocusing the e-commerce efforts on business-to-business instead of business-to-consumer,'' said James Wiggins, a Merrill spokesman. ''After experimenting for a while, we made a determination that there wasn't a huge demand for the shopping sites.''
